title: Saving Your Mobile Data Traffic
answer:
**Saving Your Mobile Data Traffic**

Why do smartphones consume so much mobile data traffic? What should we do to save the mobile data traffic?

**Why do smartphones consume so much mobile data traffic?**

Smartphones require data connection for system updates and data synchronization. Some malicious applications, games, or embedded advertisements also access the Internet in the background. 

**What should we do to prevent excessive mobile data consumption in the background?**

**1. ****Disable auto-sync on your phone.**

Your phone can automatically back up important data to the cloud, which incurs a lot of mobile data traffic consumption, especially when auto-upload of photos is enabled. 

**2. ****Disable mobile data when you do not need it. **

Drag the status bar downward to display the shortcut switch panel. Touch the mobile data switch to disable mobile data. 

**3. ****Disable mobile data when you are using Wi-Fi.**

Your phone automatically switches to the mobile data connection when Wi-Fi reception is poor, incurring mobile data traffic without your knowledge. 

**4. ****Enable mobile data traffic monitoring and restriction.**

The Phone Manager pre-installed in Huawei phones provides real-time mobile data traffic monitoring. You can view your mobile data usage, enable warning thresholds, and prevent some applications from accessing your mobile data. 

Note: You are not advised to root your phone because it may void your phone's warranty, make the system operation unstable, and incur unknown errors.
